alert.note: Alert for Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 11:27PM CDT until July 24 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Mower County in southeastern Minnesota... * Until 230 AM CDT. * At 1127 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Austin, Grand Meadow, Brownsdale, Lansing, Racine, Mayville, Dexter, Mapleview, Waltham, Elkton, Sargeant, Renova, County Roads 1 And 7, Interstate 90 And County 1, County Roads 1 And 15, Brookside Campground, Highways 63 And 16 and Hamilton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
